title: Wanted: Gay or Gay Friendly Male to Share 3 BR House
postBody:
Fully furnished room available in house near NE Killingsworth & 55th, in the Cully Neighborhood. We are close to PCC Cascadia campus. There are two regular bedrooms, and a private room in the garage. We are seeking to rent out the main bedroom, which is available now. It's roughly 12x12 with windows facing south, 2 large closets, a double bed, dressers, wall-mounted TV, computer desk, night stands, etc. There are 3 others living here, one in the main part of the house (me), and a young couple in the private garage room. We have a small dog and three harmless cats that wander around. A PCC student would get along well here. We have storage area in garage if you have extra things or don't want to use our BR furniture.
We'd like to rent to a gay guy, or at least gay/bi friendly. We are 420 friendly, but tobacco must be smoked outside. You'll have your own private room, cabinet spaces, drawers and room in the fridge. A desktop computer is available for your private use in room. We hang out together, or we go to our separate rooms, depending on moods. Please have reliable, steady income.
Rent is $500 per month, and first and last month's rent are required prior to move-in. Other than that, there are no deposits required, but we'll need $200 toward your last month's rent to hold the room after you see it and we get together on the details. Utilities are included as is wifi/ethernet, but we don't do cable or satellite at this moment.
If you think you might be a match for us, please email with a picture/selfie if you have it, and something about yourself. Please mention if you are okay with the rental arrangements described above and that you can meet the financials without difficulty.

title: 1BD - Close-in SE - Chill Roommates - Eco-Friendly
postBody:
Hey there! My roommate and I have a bedroom available immediately in our home for a single occupant. Our house is located in the Brooklyn neighborhood close-in SE Portland at Milwaukie Avenue and Mall Street. Easy access to entertainment, food, and public transportation.

THE HOUSE:

Beautiful, bright, spacious eco-friendly home. Bamboo floors. On site washer/dryer.
Brand new everything (no joke). Energy efficient. Lots of natural night
3-bedroom house, 2.5 bath.

Bedrooms on the top floor.
Two living rooms, dining room, fireplace and kitchen in the middle.
Large finished basement, bonus room, and garage downstairs.

Three stories. Lots of common space. Recreation room. Check out the picture of the living room with raised ceilings! Large back patio, planter boxes and a porch outside.

THE RENT/ROOM:

Rent is $680, due on the first of each month. Additional $1000 security deposit at move-in, refundable.
Shared utilities. No pets (NOTE: WE HAVE PARAKEETS).
Room is 10'x10' with a closet. North facing windows. Carpeted. Shared bath with one other male roommate.

THE ROOMMATES:

Two chill guys, both in their mid 20's. Open-minded. Work hard, play hard (okay, here and there!).

Nate: Environmentalist. College graduate. Outdoors. Gardening. Fitness. Hip-hop. Natural/organic everything.

Johnny: Creative. Explorer. Yoga. Film. Comics. Almost natural/organic everything.

YOU:

Ideally, we are looking for a person in their 20's. No criminal history.
Dependable income. Long term tenant.

We want you to be a reliable, straightforward adult with a full life and things to do. And, we want to be able to VIBE with you! As in hangout with you and catch up on our days... You know, roommate stuff like that.
We like to think of our house as a place where we can learn, encourage, and grow from each other.

**An application and background check is required by our rental property manager- $42 non-refundable. You can move in as soon as your application is approved by our property manager, which can take a few days (we will prorate you of course!).

We've made this place our home and inspiration. If this space sounds like a place where you can continue developing yourself and positively vibing with us then shoot us an email! Tell us what YOU'RE looking for in a home and a bit about yourself! Thanks.

**Note: We currently have two ads going for our available room. Please reply to one!

title: Lewis & Clark students/others for home close to campus!
postBody:
Newly remodeled, up-scale home in terrific, professional neighborhood with two bedrooms available. I live downstairs in a separate apartment. I would like to share my upstairs home with serious, honest, thoughtful, communicative, quiet types. Non smoker or anybody who uses non-prescriptive drugs, please! This house is not "420 friendly." It's important that we all are neat, tidy, responsible, respectful, organized, able and willing to pay rent on time every month, and have no pets. I prefer to live with women. Candles are not permitted.

The monthly rent is $650.00 for the smaller room and $750.00 for the larger room. Both are furnished with a bed, desk, dresser, bookshelf and night stand; the bathroom is shared between two people. The rooms are for single occupancy. A lease is required; if your academic program is less than one year we can discuss this.

Housing includes a washer and a dryer near the bedrooms, use of the kitchen with dishwasher, natural gas-powered kitchen stove, basic kitchen dishes and cooking items, and lots of peace and quiet. I prefer somebody who is interested in recycling and energy conservation. There is Comcast WIFI.

This is an excellent residence for a serious, responsible student or somebody who prefers peace and quiet; it is not suitable for a "partier" or somebody who is loud and noisy. It's perfect for someone interested in starting a vegetable garden in the back yard or a container garden on the deck. The yard care is handled by a professional landscaping company. Please email with any questions and to schedule an appointment for viewing.

Specifics on Location: The house is .2 mile to Lewis & Clark College. PSU is 20 downhill minutes away by bicycle. PCC Sylvania nearby. OHSU and VAMC are an easy drive down Terwilliger Blvd.. The nearest bus stop is at the corner of Terwilliger and Primrose. The Lewis & Clark bus is also available very nearby for L&C students.

Please email and tell me about yourself. The home is available now.

title: Intentional Community, Yoga, Gardening
postBody:
The Vision & Sustainability Community seeks a housemate who wants to live your vision of sustainability, wellness, community, & fun.

Beautiful, affordable, sustainable housing & community in the heart of Alberta

Available April 15.

* $486 for medium size room w/ south window

* Low utilities (Solar panels, fully insulated house, efficient gas furnace, compact fluorescents & LEDs)
* ENERGY-EFFICIENT appliances (washer, dryer, 2 refrigerators, dishwasher);
* cool INTERGENERATIONAL housemates committed to supporting one another's visions
* locked BIKE SHED
* CHEAP YOGA, meditation, & wellness classes on site

* Gas stove & great kitchen
* Big GARDEN
* OFF-STREET PARKING (limited to one additional vehicle)
* Attic Storage Space

* opportunity to buy-in to the co-op (BECOME an OWNER) after 6 months


We're a cooperatively-owned house that encourages residents to become co-owners if they vibe with the house for 6 months.

We are mainly looking for someone who already has or is genuinely interested in a daily yoga practice. It's a big plus if you also love gardening, vegetarian cooking, yoga, music, meditation &/or being the change you want.

You don't have to be a vegetarian to live in the house, although shared meals are vegetarian (you can cook & add meat). To encourage diversity in our community we especially welcome applications from women, people of color, and trans-identified people; and we will not discriminate against any qualified applicant.

No pets, smoking, or illegal drugs in house.

title: Charming Bungalow - 2br 1100ft² - Seeking Housemate
postBody:
Looking to fill the larger bedroom of a cozy 2 bedroom house just off of Alberta. This house has 8 rooms: 2 bedrooms (one is occupied by me), bathroom, living room, dining room, kitchen, laundry room, and large covered front porch. Also featured: wood flooring, functioning fireplace, and a washer and dryer on-site. The front yard is usable for lawn games, while the back yard is quieter with a vegetable garden and storage shed. The open room is approx. 180ft², with three windows and three closets.

Rent is $825. Utilities average around $90 in the summer, and can be over double in the winter. Heat is provided by electric wall cadets, which are fairly efficient and can be zoned. The common rooms are currently furnished, but I'm open to compromise as this would be our house, not my house.

About myself: I am a 32 year old architect who like to fish. Most weekends I'm out of town enjoying the outdoors. I aspire to home cooked meals and a clean environment.

About you: Fully employed. Knows how to live with others and cleans up after yourself. Social gatherings are encouraged, but frequent parties are not. Stability is a big plus as well, of course. There is plenty of gardening potential in the back yard, so green thumbs are most welcome.

Additionally:
Move-in date is April 1st.
Deposit equivalent to first month's rent is required.
Month-to-month lease.
Dogs are not allowed. I like dogs, but they make me itchy and are not permitted on the lease anyway. Cats are negotiable.

title: Room with private entry $500 plus utilities
postBody:
Hello there !!!
We have a bedroom opening in our awesome house April 1st! $500 per month, deposit $600, $20 application fee. NOTE- the application fee we only be charged to the person we select:

About the house:

Located off Fremont and 50th in North east Portland. The house is a very short walk (blocks) to restaurants, bars, and shops on Fremont. Two MAX stations, Safeway, and Trader Joes are all about a mile away. Also just over a mile to the heart of Alberta St.

The room is a mid sized room with private entry way that is located on the ground floor next to the kitchen. It does not have an enclosed closet but there is a space to hang clothes.

The house has a decent sized entry room and dining area, large kitchen, large backyard, and large basement we use for movie nights and as a craft/ art space. The basement has a late TV that is hooked up to Netdlix. We also have a jacuzzi although we don't use it too too much at this time.

You will have your own cupboard and shelf or drawer in the fridge for your own food. Only one bathroom so we try to keep shower time to under 20-30 min per day
About us:

One is in his late 20's and works full time Monday-Friday as a sales rep for a outdoor/sports company.

Another in her early 30's and works at nearby cafe. She likes to craft and resell vintage items.

The other is in his early 40's and works as a full time artist with a focus on visionary art.

What we are looking for:

Someone with their shit together. We aren't interested in someone that is struggling financially. We need to feel secure you can pay $500 for rent plus another $100 or so for utilities. ( that includes internet, electricity, trash, and water)

Someone that doesn't party too hard... And defiantly doesn't bring the party home... Most the time we are in bed before midnight.

Smoking is alright on the front patio or back but never in the house. We don't mind a beer or so to unwind for the night but no raging alcoholics please. Must be 420 friendly as one of us is a medicinal patient.

YOUR TURN:

Tell us about yourself and why you think you would be a great fit. We will only meet with people that we think are right for our place. Must mention out lease is up mid September. It looks like the home owners are planning to renew our lease but just something to keep on mind. We will only accept people that are committed to staying through mid September.

No pets please or children please

title: Master Room near MHCC
postBody:
Looking for a roommate to share my two bedroom apartment with at the Rivercrest Apartments near Mt. Hood Community College.

PLEASE, if you decide to respond, read the entire ad AND do not ask if it's still available. I will take the ad down when it isn't. I promise.

The apartment is mostly furnished and the available room is clean and empty. The only common items I'm missing from my apartment are a TV and some wall decorations. The kitchen is basically complete, plus I have couches and tables. The apartment also come with new carpet, a cement balcony (including attached storage), vaulted ceiling, dishwasher and garbage disposal. The apartment complex provides plenty of street and guest parking as well as the covered spot, a small gym, sauna, outdoors hot tub as well as friendly management.


About me,
Im 23, born and raised in Portland. I currently take care of people with disabilities for a living, I have my own car and financially support myself (as i hope you do too, but neither are a deal breaker). I don't drink alcohol very often or do hard drugs but I am an OMMP patient, so keep that in mind. I clean up after myself and I don't leave messes. I'm also a very thoughtful, reasonable and respectful person who is mainly looking for someone responsible and reasonable to pay bills on time as well as a person I can trust.

-Couples are welcome but it's also $50 more per month for rent and PGE split 3 ways.
-Refundable $150 deposit negotiable but preferred

And just to be clear, $475 is the cost of the room. All other monthly bills are separate

So, if this sounds like a good fit then please email or call at a reasonable time and leave a message letting me know about you're current living situation, what you can afford for bills per month and any other questions about myself or the room that you may have. Other than that, good luck on your search and enjoy the nice weather while it lasts!

PS,
If you text or email, a picture would be great and I will send one in return

title: Rent front half of my house April 1st, May 1st
postBody:
Hi my name is April and I am a single working girl in my late 30's looking for a working professional with stable income 30 or older working one single mellow girl/guy to share half of my one story home. April 1st anytime in April, or May 1st!

Kids here would not be good full time as it is only a one bedroom, small closet, and they would not have their own room to sleep and as well as a yard even.

Pets may consider 1 small dog or 1 or 2 indoor cat if they are to do no damage to my home, and you pick up after your pet, Litter box extra, but no pets might be best. I have a rabbit and a cat, and they both live on my side of the house, will not go to your side of the house.

Close to SE 52nd and Woodstock area with your own front door entry. I prefer someone who already lives in Oregon, or at least I am able to meet you to know if this would work out or not. I live in the back of the house, where I have my own entry and we both share the middle kitchen and laundry would be on site.

You would get one bedroom 10x12 with small closet fit for one person, your own bathroom with a tub, and the front living room of the home to yourself with a door that would lead to you going to the kitchen in the middle of the house. The area you will be renting isn't a small area; it is like renting a 1 bedroom apartment without kitchen. This area has hardwood floors, your bedroom has carpet and the bathroom has nice big tiles. Lots of windows in the living room space.

Would like someone who is clean, honest, trustworthy person who won't cause no damage to the home/things in the home, is respectful, will be able to communicate to me. As well someone who will pay rent on time as this goes towards my mortgage and this is very important to me. Prefer none cigarette smoker, if you smoke it is to be outside off the property but 420 friendly, (no other drugs) OMMP friendly can't grow here due to old electricity at this time, and there is street parking.

Rent 640.00, 320.00 refundable damage deposits, do to any damage that could be, or it can go towards the last months bills that you will have before you move. I rent every six months with a lease that when u sign it will state; if you brake the lease, you pay 320.00 plus I keep ur 320 deposit, and you pay the last months rent with bills. If things work we can renew the lease for the next 6 months. I require at least 2 months notice in advance if you decide you want to leave so I am able to get a new renter, as this will be in the lease too. Rent will be increased a little after every year of being here.

1\2 utilities Internet WIFI Comcast 33.00 a month, Gas, Water, Electricity, Garbage. Water is every three months and is around $269 to $365. Garbage is every two months $30.00. Gas and Electricity very on summer to winter months and how often the Gas heat is on in the winter months since the bills is affected by both, summer is the cheapest time for gas and electricity. Bills for the home can be very reasonable as long as you be self conscious about them with gas and electric and water. Bills come at the end of each month so paying rent with bills in the beginning of each month is how this would work. No TV service in the home as I only pay for internet and watch my shows online.

I can meet Tue-Fri after 4pm or so, then the weekends too. If you are interested please email me, or text me with your name and a little about yourself, age extra. I can show you the side you be living in when meeting, and the kitchen too.

Thank you. April

Here are some details about the neighborhood:
- Sellwood/ Westmoreland is a very family-oriented
- Easy access to the Spring Water Corridor for those who commute via bicycle
- Near the 19 and 70 bus line - blocks away!
- Orange MAX line will be opening in January and will be blocks away as well
- Centrally located to restaurants, shops, grocery stores, cafes and a park all in walking distance
- Close to Reed College & Portland State University


We welcome LGBTQ individuals, patrons of Farmer's Markets, cyclists, 420, co-op supporters and down-to-earth housemates! My name is Devin, please email or text me with the address listed above if you are interested and would like to view the home. Please include a description about yourself. Please, serious inquiries only.

Good luck on your search.

title: Room for rent in Private home in Northeast Portland
postBody:
I have for rent on a month to month basis a bedroom in a private residence in Northeast Portland you would have your own bedroom and bath with access to the entire house and yard. You should be a older female 18+ no children small dog only non smoker and no sleepovers. The home is located close to the bus line, College/University, freeway access, Parks and Recreation and Shopping Malls. The home is located in the area of 194th. Ave. and Glisan. title: Room mate needed for down town apartment!
postBody:
Hi! Does the room share hunt have you in the dumps? Fret no more!

I'm looking for someone who wants to find an apartment in downtown/Pearl/Southwest/northwest part of Portland. Finding that perfect room mate situation in the perfect place can be a game of blind luck. I don't know about you, but I don't like to settle for less than I want. So lets shake things up and find the perfect room mate, then find the perfect place in a killer part of town.


About Me:

I'm a 30 year old professional male presently working for an environmental non-profit. I'm an avid snowboarder, runner, camper, sports fan (I'll watch anything with a ball), and enjoy going to shows. I try to maintain a healthy life style, but still allow myself to enjoy the finer points of greasy foods and beer. I'm a pretty laid back guy who appreciates a clean and tidy space.

I'm pretty open to who my new house mate will be. I prefer a 25-35 clean and responsible individual who has ambition and is focused on what they want in life. Preferably, someone who communicates well, wants to socialize on occasion, but also has their own circle of friends.

If you're also an amazing person who is just wanting to live in a great space in Portland, shoot me a text. We can grab a coffee and see if we'd make great house mates.

title: COUNTRY LIVING ON NW PORTLAND FARM
postBody: We are looking for a single renter that is animal wise or willing to learn to be able to tend to our sheep and horses when we occasionally take a trip for $$ off their rent.  The bedroom is 12 X 14 feet with a large closet fully furnished,  we provide all linen and towels and all cooking pots, pans and dishes.  Approximately 11 miles from Intel, DT Portland and Scappoose .  Kitchen, laundry, bath and all utilities included.  Very private home in the country.  Hiking, biking area next to the new metro Forest Park.  We plant a large garden each Spring and have laying hens that can help with your food expense if you are willing to help tend to them.  All 4 of our horses are in their twenties and our sheep are easy care.  We also will deduct from rent any additional labor you might want to help with like; fencing, firewood, landscaping, etc..  A long term renter would be good but 6 months is also OK.  No smoking in house or outbuildings, no dogs as we have 3 of our own, no overnight guests or day guests without our permission and NO DRUGS!!!  For further information please call or email us and we can set up an appointment

title: Room Available in NE Portland
postBody:
Looking for a couple to move in and share a room in the Cully Neighborhood. I need a couple to maintain affordable rent. I would take the smaller of the house's two rooms.

The house is cozy, and fairly modest as far as size goes. It is a 2 Bedroom/1 Bath house in a secluded little section of 6 identical homes. There's a yard with a garden and a composting area. There are solar panels on the roof and a garage that is mostly used for storage at the moment. The laundry room, which has a brand new washer and dryer, is also attached to the garage. The kitchen has a brand new gas stove and dishwasher. The bedroom for rent has a couple big windows which let in plenty of natural lighting.

There are no pets here currently but dogs and cats are both welcome!

DETAILS:
Rent is usually around $600/person give or take. (This means a total of about $1200/month for the couple.)
The total rent is $1,595/month not including utilities.
Pet Rent of $25/month.
Utilities range from $40-$70/person depending on usage.
There is a $500 deposit per person before moving in.

About you:
Drama free couple
Cleanliness/General Courtesy
Relaxed and stress free
Respectful of space and other people's belongings

About Your Roommate:
Ben is 25. He studied literature and history and loves to read. He works at Ikea while waiting to find a job in editing. He is often at home making food, playing video games, and just relaxing.

Send an email or text Ben if you're interested and include a little bit about yourself.

title: and utilities. Share our friendly, clean, mature and dog-loving home.
postBody:
I have an unfurnished bedroom to rent to a single individual in our friendly and comfortable home. (Please do not contact me if you are more than one person or if you wish to bring your cat or pets other than dogs). We currently have a mix of genders and an age range of 50 - 75 but are open to any aged housemate. We pick up after ourselves and always treat each other with respect. Good communication and plenty of laughter abound here.

Since I always get phishing responses to these ads, I will not reply if you send me a message that only asks me to contact you, or only asks if the room is still available. Please tell me a little about yourself and your work schedule/home lifestyles when you reply.

We have 4 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, and no more than 4 of us live here at any time. There is plenty of room for both private time and shared activities.

The house is no smoking (of any substance) and no one does more than light drinking. Our professions are varied - business manager, landscape architect/arborist, and hospice social worker. Our hobbies /interests include cooking, bicycling, frisbee golf, boat building, gardening, herbology, watching movies, spinning, weaving and sewing. All food preferences are welcome. But you do have to like dogs, even if you do not own one. You also have to be willing to live fragrance-free -- more on that follows

The available bedroom is on the main floor of the house and is 10 x 10. It will comfortably hold a Full or Queen size bed and a dresser and desk. It has a small walk-in close as well as its own hallway closet. It has windows on two walls and bright afternoon light. You will share a full bath with one other person and have your own off-street parking space and extra basement storage.

The room rents for $ 385/month. Per person, utilities average $115- $135/month. This includes EVERYTHING - water and sewer, trash, cable TV (only basic channels), high speed internet, gas, electric, and yard maintenance. The $50 screening fee pulls a public records report and summary of your credit standing (not a full credit report, none of your accounts are revealed). The security and pet deposits are fully refundable. I ask for a $500 security deposit and if you have a dog, a $100 pet deposit. I am open to spreading out the deposits over a couple of months and I do not ask for last month's rent unless a person has very bad credit or rent payment history.

Two dogs will live here when you move in and we can easily handle one more. The two current pooches spends most of their time with their person and are 10 years old fairly docile. All furry friends must be non-aggressive, peaceably share space with others, be well mannered, and be kept clean and flea treated with Frontline, Advantix or Comfortis. "Yappers" or even large dogs that bark a lot will not work well here. We all like and know dogs, and every dog owner that has ever lived here has told me how good they felt about having their dog stay with us. We often help each other with occasional pet sitting, or putting someone else's dog outside or feeding, when s/he has to work long hours, etc.

This is a 1900 sq ft older home in the Errol Heights neighborhood. We occupy a pocket of Portland, that while not too far from most "happenings", is loaded with old growth trees, green spaces, wild peacocks and occasional coyotes. We are surrounded by large lots and friendly neighbors. Away from any main thoroughfare, the primary noises here are a beautiful symphony of birdcalls when in season and rustling trees.

The home has central gas heat and A/C; washer/dryer, and dishwasher. All floors are wood --(although old and somewhat marred). We have high speed wireless internet in every room and on the deck. There is a large deck, fenced in vary large yard, and a community garden one block away. If you wish you can begin a garden on the grounds.

We maintain a "clean air" home - avoiding products that off-gas fragrances and other fumes. I can explain this better when we speak with each other - but the simple explanation is that things like our soaps, lotions, shampoos and laundry products are all fragrance free (I provide up to $35 in refunds for the cost of replacing your current items.) Items that off-gas fumes, such as hair gels and nail polish cannot be used.

Commuting times: We are a 5-minute walk to the 75 bus line and a slightly longer walk to the 72. We are very close to Johnson Creek and the Spring Water Corridor and bike paths. Driving times in good traffic: to Reed College, 7 minutes; to inner SE, 10 minutes; to downtown 15 - 20 minutes; to Clackamas Town Center or the Home Depot on SE 82nd about 15 minutes.

If all of this sounds like what you are looking for, please reply and tell me a little about yourself and your lifestyle, and tell me how I should contact you.

Good luck in your home hunting-

title: Cute Room in Clean and Relaxed Belmont/Hawthorne Home $650 + Util
postBody:
####
Quick note: To save ourselves time and hence get back to people faster we're having people apply using a simple form rather than having emails drop into one person's inbox. It's super easy we promise! (We still take email but the form is much preferred.)

Here's the super fast and easy form for applying:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1tmhHa_pc8gKz_K7_0wwAzEU6iakkKYfMDsPwi_PhQAw/viewform?usp=send_form
####

Hello There,

We're currently a house of 3 looking to fill an empty room here in SE. Ideal candidate is mid 20s through 30s, who's easy to get along with, picks up after themselves, is working towards things in their life (work or otherwise), enjoys being sociable with the roomies on occasion, and is OK living in a house with generally busy people.

The house is really nice and has an amazing location; we're centrally located near 29th between Belmont and Hawthorne. Groceries, multiples bus lines, bike paths, coffee shops, music venues, bars, restaurants, movie theaters, and the like are all a 3-10 minute walk.

Room in questions is $650/month + utilities which vary from about $38/mo summer to $70/mo winter. Room is available April 4th (though we may be able to push it to the first if needed). Lease is 6 months, then month to month.

We know that looking for housing on Craigslist is no fun so we've got some basic requirements to save us both some time.

-6 Months stable employment or in school with a demonstrable income.

-No pets (Charlie who's in the pics below got grandfathered in, but he's on his way out)

-Before we can offer the room we'll need 2 references from former roommates (though you don't have to provide them to see the house and meet us).

-The room is for one person only. Apologies to couples.


The room is really one and a half rooms, one ~ 9'x12' spot where you'll probably put your bed and the like, but connected to that is your own windowed sun room that looks out over the back yard ( ~ 6'x12' ). It'd be a great spot for a desk or a lounging chair; it's small but very awesome.

Otherwise the house has a great big downstairs with a nice kitchen and a decent sized very private back yard.

As stated above there's currently 3 people in the house. S has a landscape architecture degree on top of being in graduate school; B works at a local university doing video, and D works at a tech recruiting firm when he isn't putting his years of kitchen experience to use.

The pics of the room below aren't the room in question but its twin across the hall. (The room in question currently has a bunch of stuff in it and is hence not photogenic) The room that's up has a smaller closet but more square footage.

We'll be setting up meet and greats with people the evenings of the 22nd and 23rd (Sun and Mon). If those dates don't work for you we can try and set something else up as well. We prefer to interview everyone before making any kind of decisions so there's no benefit to showing up Sunday rather than Monday.

(Also, I have no idea what CL means by "Private Room"; it doesn't have its own entrance to the outside, but it does have a door and people don't walk through it to get to the kitchen or anything like that.)

title: Private Furnished Upstairs ~ Conscientious Clean Shared House ~ $500
postBody:
*Our 4 bedroom home already houses 3 working adults and 2 delightful canines with room to spare. The upstairs consists of a bedroom and small office. It is available now. Will be month to month, refundable $500 deposit, and $500 monthly fee due the beginning of each month (includes utilities). We are right off Foster, 82nd Ave, I-205, Glenwood Park, Clackamas Town Center, Woodstock neighborhood, Reed College, and major bus/max lines and bicycle route (Spring Water Corridor) which all go directly to downtown Portland and elsewhere for easy commuting. If you own a vehicle there is plenty of street parking.

*We are not taking any couples, additional pets, children, etc. However we do not discriminate based on race, gender, age, sexual orientation, food preference, etc.

~ RESPONSIBLE - We ask that you lock the house when nobody's home. Latch the gates behind you and make sure the dogs didn't slip out in the process. Don't leave dishes for more than a day or two in the sink. Fill the dog bowl if it happens to be out of water. Have a job or reliable income. Give 30 days notice before moving out. Only invite over trusted loved ones who will also uphold the ambiance of our home.

~ CONSCIENTIOUS - Show an eagerness to add to the positivity and comfort of the overall energy and atmosphere in our home with simple actions such as picking up after yourself, sharing basic chores for the communal areas, having basic manners. We make an effort to keep noise down when anyone's sleeping (dogs bark occasionally), but since each bedroom is on it's own floor the noise doesn't travel as much.

~ COMPASSIONATE - We all love animals, nature, truth, art, science, and people from many walks of life. I am partial to Buddhism, yoga, meditation, The Grateful Dead, hot springs, and relaxation. I strive to be straight forward and direct but still very considerate and empathetic. I don't like cynicism and sarcasm. If you have something to say just say it respectfully. I will consider suggestions or requests from all house members to keep life peaceful and comfortable for everybody. You will not need to join the house lease. We are mostly vegetarians but ok with meat in the house.

~ COMMUNITY - Have you ever lived in a communal setting before? What types of communities are you already an active member of? Do you have a boyfriend/girlfriend and how often do you plan to have company over? Do you identify with any religious orientation? These are the things we want to know that will enable us to tell you whether or not we will a good fit.

A LITTLE ABOUT OURSELVES:

Jessica - I'm 26 years old. Bartender and full time student at PCC&PSU. I love my boyfriend and our dogs. The house and bills here are solely in my name and will remain so. The owner is a lovely lady who lives in Kansas so you will deal directly with me. I grew up on a farm near Silverton where I spent most of my first 18 years getting to know nature, growing/cooking food, and riding/training horses. Most of the time I am busy with work, school, and taking care of the house/dogs. In my free time I like to get out as much as possible - hiking, swimming, beach, hot springs, mountains, desert, gatherings/festivals/events. I am always friendly, but sometimes quiet.

Jsun - My partner of 2 years. 39 years old. Jsun has worked for OCF and BRC and a variety of other jobs. He is from New York and tells it like it is. Jsun is good with people and problem solving.

Bandit and Tela - Our 2 awesome lovable dogs. You must love and have a good general understanding for dogs. These are both very sweet and special spirits of our home. Bandit is my dog and stays with me always. He is a 4 year old Blue Heeler. He is calm in the home and a maniac for fetch when he is outside. He gets 2 to 3 trips to the park across the street for fetch every day due to his need to run run chase chase. He doesn't bark often, but when he does ocassionally see a critter or intruder of some kind in the yard he can get a little loud, but settles down quickly. I sometimes offer our roommates/friends money or trade in exchange for dog sitting for a weekend or more now and then. If that is something that interests you then that's a big plus. Tela is Jsun's puppy, she is a super sensitive and silly 6 month old Olde English Bulldogge. If you know anything about them she is a big couch potato. She is usually cuddling on the couch with us or her blanket and watching TV or listening to the local radio jazz station or Grateful Dead shows. She is strong and does like to rough house and play tug of war, usually with bandit. Their growling and chasing can get a little loud sometimes but they settle down pretty quickly. Neither one has a mean bone in their body.

Chad - this is our other tenant who rents half of our basement which includes a bedroom, bathroom and den. He is an easy going 30 something bachelor that works nights, sleeps days, and so is rarely seen. The basement also contains the laundry which is shared, as well as a small 4th bedroom which will be used as storage.

We will be subleasing our upstairs by the end of the month. It is about 14'x10'. Keep in mind the ceiling is only about 7' high and slanted on the sides so a lot of normal furniture will not fit. The room thus far has served as a guest room and is already semi - furnished, as you can see from the pictures which aren't very good it has some junk accumulated in it that will be gone before you move in. If you want to use the coffee table, futon, chairs, closet, table, and other items already in the room you are welcome to them. At the bottom of the stairs to the right is my office and library. To the left is the living room. Through this is the kitchen with lots of cabinet space. Then there is a hall where the bathroom is located and next to that is my bedroom. In the kitchen you will have space for food, but we already have dishes and utensils to spare. The bathroom has a small clawfoot bathtub/shower, toilet, and sink, but is somewhat limited on space.

title: APRIL 1st! Room in unique house available
postBody:
We will have a room available on the upper level of our 6 Bedroom / 3 Bathroom tri-level house by APRIL 1st. It's a smaller room that would be a great transitional space for someone just moving to Portland, best suited for someone with a busy life, someone who travels or works a lot, or maybe someone who reads, sleeps, or is on the computer a lot when they're home, and doesn't have a lot of stuff.
We are seeking a kind, fun, considerate, friendly person - really, someone who would fit in comfortably here, and appreciate being a part of our unique household with all that it has to offer.
We are an interesting blend of men & women of various ages - an eclectic mix of the kind of people that make Portland such a great place to live - artists, students, baristas, skateboarders, bike riders, hikers, internet entrepreneurs, musicians. We are all fairly introverted and share a variety of common interests. We are all kind, respectful, creative, art-oriented, comedy, literature, music & movie loving liberals, with widely varied schedules, and active lives.
We also have 2 cute, small, nice dogs, and a friendly (mostly outdoor) cat.
The addition we are seeking will be considerate, friendly, and responsible; have a great sense of humor and be easy to talk to; like animals, but preferably have none of their own; have stable finances and an active life; not be a big drinker; not need to have overnight guests; and willing to do the majority of their socializing away from the house.
This is a very respectfully 420-friendly household, but no smoking or open flames in the house.
We are mostly meat-eaters, but we do welcome tolerant vegetarians/vegans.
The house has a nice fenced backyard with fountains, and some gardening space is available.
We're located within a short walking distance to several buses and MAX lines (#15 Belmont, #20 Burnside, #4 Division, the MAX Greenline and Blueline).
The house is in a quiet, safe, residential neighborhood within easy walking distance to many useful amenities. We are very close to Mall 205 (Please ~ be sure to mapquest zip 97216 or look up Trimet stops #11027 or #11411 before responding to determine if the location will work for you). Near a Dollar Store, Big Lots, Target, Home Depot, and many other useful shops, businesses, and restaurants. The Eastside Community Center is only three blocks away, and it offers lots of great classes, an awesome new pool, a weight room, and outdoor track. Adventist Hospital (where there is a vegan bistro) and the East Portland police station are also very close to our house. Powell Butte and Mt. Tabor are nearby for spontaneous hiking and biking. We are very centrally located with a freeway exit to I-205 only a couple minutes away. Bike riders - we are close to bike paths AND we have our own in-house bike mechanic!
It's $400/month, which includes utilities. Furnished, possibly.
Applicants offering First + Last are preferred (possibly negotiable).
Interested? We hope to hear from you!

title: Share large house with 1 others person near Alberta
postBody:
I'm renting out the room on the top floor with a private bathroom to 1 person . The bathroom has a claw foot tub but no shower . There is a shower downstairs that is shared. This room is huge ! Big walk in closet , large windows and sky lights . There is a landing area perfect for an office, all carpeted, and with tons of storage space. The shared spaces in the house are the living room ,kitchen, and shower. There's a beautiful yard with a garden and side porch area.
The downstairs is all hard wood floor, washer and dryer in the house , storage shed available and an amazing kitchen with gas range! The house is located in the Concordia neighborhood. Just a short walk away from Alberta, Killingsworth, and the Concordia New Seasons/Walgreens/Hot Lips etc .

The house also comes with Mahjong an old lady Husky Corgi mix who captures the hearts of many. Im open to a well behaved and charming cat :)

Me: Professional , works full time as a Social Worker, I am 34 years old. Queer. I have lived here for 2 years. I keep busy and enjoy cooking up a storm in the kitchen and relaxing in the living room. I have friends over for meals and am also out a lot.
You: It's important to have a housemate that is compatible on important things like respect, communication, general cleanliness, and can be quiet at night. If you are similarly described, & would enjoy a tidy home to re charge, enjoy and have a sense of humor please email me!

-The room 500$ a month + utilities . Total move in costs are first+last rent +375 security deposit . Utilities are electric, gas, water (every 3 months) and internet.

Misc:
There are fruit trees (plum, cherry, asian pear, kiwi berries and a grapes) And some yard work to do ( weeding, mowing etc) There are 3 raise beds to plant in.

title: Easygoing/musician/responsible 35yr old male

I am a musician/artist/creator. I'm originally from North Carolina & have lived in PDX for almost 4 years. I work as a dishwasher at Intel & will be looking for work closer to where I move. My preference would be NE or SE, but I'm open to other locations.

My band is Stellamorphic www.facebook.com/Stellamorphosis I also create meditation music: ascensionbootcamp222.bandcamp.com Currently I'm focused on what I'm doing with Stellamorphic & we are also looking to collaborate with others to create music.

I clean up after myself, pay my rent on time & am super easy going, open minded & hoping to find the same.

Please send me a msg if you think we could try this out. Good hunting to you & thanks for your time!
Justin

title: Room for rent in house. Single dad with 2 kids
postBody:
Room for rent in a cool house. The house was just recently renovated a few months ago right before I moved in. Freshly painted inside and out! I'm a single dad raising 2 boys on my own (they're 8 & 10, I'm 33). We're really laid back nice people looking for the same. The room is $500 a month plus 1/3 utilities, no deposit or any of that crap. The room measures 17ft by 8.5ft with windows on 2 sides and plenty of natural light! I work mornings and the kids go to school during the week so during the weekdays were not home till after 3 so it's pretty quiet during the day times here. I'm willing to rent the room to another single parent with one kid because it's a pretty big room and I know how it is to be on your own raising a little one. Plus maybe we could trade on babysitting or something.
A little about me: I'm an ex punk drummer, was in a several bands at a time devoting my life to music until I got full custody of my two little boys when they were 1yr and the other one was 1 week old. So I had to change my life obviously and become the responsible adult I resisted for so long. Now I'm a server in a breakfast joint going back to school in the fall. I don't really know what else to write so just give me a call and we'll talk and stuff. My iPhone for some reason doesn't ring all the time so just leave me a message and I'll get back to ya if I don't pick up. Thanks! Dru

title: Master Bedroom - All Util. Incl.
postBody:
Well, hello there. Could you be the roommate we've been hoping for? Okay- I hate writing these things. Here are the facts and ramblings about the room/house/expectations/roommates:

Second floor master bedroom available in April
- Softwood pine floors
- 2 closets, built-ins and a sunny nook for a desk/chaise lounge/mini couch
- North and West facing windows (looks out to backyard)
- I can't remember square footage off the top of my head, but the room is large (and not 'large' in a 'cozy' way- it's a legit big room)

House is a remodeled 1909 Craftsman in the heart of the Sabin neighborhood.
- softwood, pine floors throughout
- one 1st floor bedroom, 2 upstairs
- 1st floor full-bath features clawfoot tub
- 2nd floor bath features a 2-person shower
- oil heat on main floor, electric heat in upstairs bedrooms
- detached garage, unfinished basement (laundry), backyard and quiet street with the greatest neighbors ever (not to brag)
- 1st floor is an open floorplan with great kitchen for cooking equipped with dishwasher, a living room and a weird small room at the base of the stairs that I still can't figure out what to do with.
- Large front porch that captures all the morning sunlight
- 2 small garden plots that are in dire need of attention
- House comes equipped with an 8 year old indoor/outdoor cat

Roommate expectations
- participate in keeping the house in order (like, cleaning with a sponge!)
- be respectful/considerate/mindful/(insert other adjective) of the house, roommates, cat
- scent-free (please please please no incense, perfumes/colognes, heavily fragranced shower products like Axe, room sprays, febreeze or other things of the sort)
- pay rent in-full and on-time
- keep the partying at locations other than the house (great alternatives to this house include: the bar and other people's houses)
- It would be ideal if you'd be willing to take an active role in the home environment and speak up if something isn't working for you. We're open to criticism and communication (we both majored in art, we can take it). We really just want someone (or a couple) who can be communicative and respectful. And I'm poaching this line off of someone else's posting because it is well-put:We're looking for someone who understands and values a sense of community, privacy and accountability.

About the two people you'd be living with:
- We're both named Emily- though we spell our names differently
- Emily 2 (shhhh don't tell her I said that) is in her early 30s, a full-time engineering student at PSU and is a hilarious and all-around wonderful human being. Due to her crazy schedule she is out of the house most days for long hours and needs a quiet place to come home to. You'll rarely see her.
- I am also in my early 30s, work for a national non-profit as their data-nerd, boulder (indoor and outdoor), pretend like I'm going to run a marathon, obsess over jigsaw puzzles and love playing strategy board games. I keep myself pretty busy with lots of other projects outside of work, so I also like to have a quiet home to decompress at.
- Neither of us tends to have out-of-town visitors, but the occasional person may come and stay (with all-house approval first).
- Emily and I are both easy-going people and love to socialize when we actually have the time to do so. We both tend to limit our in-house socializing to activities like small dinner/brunch gatherings, game nights and other low-key affairs.
- Neither of us owns a tv and we'd ask that if you bring one you'd refrain from putting it in the common space.
-We also don't care what your diet is just so long as you clean up after yourself in the kitchen.

Other things about things:
Rent is $875/mo for a single person, $1,000/mo for a couple. All utilities are included in rent (water/sewer, electric, heat, garbage, internet). Lease is month-to-month, but it would be great if you plan to stay at minimum 6 months. You can have the driveway parking space if you want it.

We are a few blocks from Whole Foods and within a short walk to Alberta and Williams.

Email me if you want to come by and see the space. Looking forward to meeting you!

title: $500 bedroom for rent/ all utilities included
postBody:
Hi I'm Andy Im wanting to share m. townhome which is a 3 bedroom 2.5 bath with a private patio. It is 2 blocks away from the max station on 148th and one block away from Glendoveer
park/golf course which has a 2 mile run/jog/walking trail. I'm looking for a mature financially secure roommate who is open to sharing a house with other mature housemates. The room available is the the northern facing bedroom which has good closet space and stays nice and cool in the summers. All utilities are included Cable, internet, water, sewer, garbage,natural gas, power, air conditioning this place has it all. It is an end unit so your surroundings are relatively quiet and secluded compared to some of the other units. I would prefer someone that generally picks up after themselves. Your roommates will be from the age 29-55 that are mature and environmentally concious. We do recycle however I wouldn't classify us as tree huggers just yet! I think so far i have the perfect roommates who pretty much keep to themselves,non-partiers,trustworthy,respectful and enjoy the clean environment! I cannot stress the words Cleanliness and Respectful enough! It only takes one person to screw it all up and we are not looking for that person :). We are not looking for buddies,craigslist friends, or to gain any social advantages, we are simply looking for a roommate to share a house. You are preferably someone who has lived in a shared housing situation and has the common sense to figure out how to co-exist with others!
Also if you are energy concient that would be nice!
Alot of times i literally feel as though i live here alone as everyone either works full time or keeps busy with their personal lives that you hardly notice them living here. They are all mature,laid back and respectful of each others belongings. I have a 5 yr old miniature labradoodle name Sam so you must like dogs as he will try to cuddle with you. No drugs will be tolerated on the premises. Social drinking is fine, and id prefer it if you didn't have too many people coming and going from the house.I'm asking for first months rent plus $250 security deposit prior to move in. Please be employed or have a source of income, as I will not chase anyone around for rent. Single occupancy only. Please be able to pass a background check and have a good rental history,verifiable references as i am a master screener and will do my research! Please call Andy for a possible viewing show contact info I will NOT respond to email as I cannot distinguish whether it is a spam.
Again place is available March 12, 2015 on a month agreement but would prefer someone with intentions of staying at least 6 months. Goodluck! P.S We do have furniture :) !

title: BR w/private bath & LR in 2BR apartment
postBody:
My wonderful housemate is joining a house with a garden & other musicians, so I'm looking for someone new to share our 975sf, ground floor, 2BR apartment. I'm looking to share with just one other person, for at least 9 months and preferably indefinitely, and will respond to everyone who responds in full accordance with this ad. Everything is 50/50, averaging just under $500/mo.: Rent ($437.50), electric & broadband internet. No cable TV or land line.

I'm subletting one bedroom (10'x13', counting the closet), it's accompanying full bath (40sf) and the living room & adjoining closets (300sf), available Saturday, April 11th (unless the carpet cleaning is delayed - to be confirmed very soon). So this could work well for someone with more furniture than could fit in the bedroom. My room has its own bath, and I'm generally there, in the kitchen or in the breakfast nook, which I use as a home office. I have no pets but love them, so yours are possible with a nonrefundable pet fee to the landlord ($300 + $150 per additional up to 3 total), though it would be important to stay on top of any shedding, for me to meet them, not to be noisy or smelly, etc.

The unit was completely renovated 2-3 years ago, with new kitchen appliances, W/D in unit and large and fenced patio in back. We're off a dead-end street, 50 yards from a natural area in a low traffic neighborhood halfway between Hollywood & Gateway, walking distance to Fred's, a 5 minute walk from two bus lines, a 10 minute walk to three max lines, and 1-5 minutes from I-84. If you have a car, you would use a visitor slot; I did this for 4 months, almost always had my favorite slot and had to park on the street on only 1 occasion. I'm very bike friendly, but you'd probably have to park just inside, on a rug to spare the carpet. (My bikes hang in a closet off the patio.)

The room has off-white paint on sheet rock walls, one 3' x 6' window facing north into the parking court, vertical slat blinds, a closet 2' deep x 7' wide with white sliding doors, a single frosted glass light fixture in the middle of the ceiling, and a brown carpet.

The owner will need $50 to run a background check before we can sign. To hold the room, I'll also need a $500 security deposit along with first month's rent, which can be pro-rated, and a simple, month-to-month homeshare agreement, to keep us in sync about the basics:
http://blog.oregonlive.com/hg_impact/2009/05/RENT%20AGMNT%203.pdf

I'm a 52 year old man and long term experienced housemate, not looking for anything except a mature, considerate, responsible and fairly quiet person to share costs, although common interests are always nice and I'm friendly enough when the boundaries are secure. I have plenty of good housemate references when we get to that point, and might ask for a couple from you as well. I've been more comfortable with most of my past housemates 28 or older than younger. I'm fine with all sexes, genders & views, but prefer not to live with anyone who uses drugs, smokes, drinks much alcohol, depends heavily on caffeine, or entertains a lot or indiscreetly. I'm stable, reliable, considerate and manage my own needs, and need the same in my housemate. I'm self-employed working with adults with developmental disabilities, having left high tech to free up time for community organizing around local food systems and sustainable economy. I'm deeply into nature, lived abroad for a long time, have a graduate degree, am divorced with no kids, and do no illegal drugs or marijuana, but do use plant tinctures and might smudge a little. I drink two beers or glasses of wine once every 1-3 months. I rest a lot, usually in my room, because recovering from a long term health issue, but am again riding, swimming & hiking, and thinking about picking up yoga or going back to qi gong. My own possessions are pretty minimal. I was car free for several years, but had to get a car for my clients' sake, though I don't drive it much compared to most. Very involved with spirituality, but private about it and accustomed to not sharing that with house mates. I have respect for healing and service. I'm home a lot, but usually quiet & private and am very considerate, though lately not as clean as neat for lack of time. But I keep pretty on top of dishes, fridge & counters and would need you to as well: after security & quiet, the single most important part of sharing space. I watch a few internet videos, mostly quietly in my room, but no TV or loud music and few hollywood movies. I can be pretty frumpy at home in my sweats, slippers & down vest. I usually socialize while I'm out & about, and entertain here only quietly and very occasionally, and would prefer a house mate who's visitors are also considerate and fairly quiet. Night time quiet is important.

If interested, please tell me about yourself in relation to what I've written here, your experience with homesharing and anything else that comes up for you. Thanks & best of luck in your search for a good place to live!

title: Giant Room for Rent In Beautiful Old-World Home (Dog Friendly)
postBody:
Hello Portland,

We are looking for an individual to join us in our old-world styled home. The room is available now, but we're not in a hurry to fill it. We'll hold the space for a good fit.

It's located in Northeast Portland a little west of the Montavilla neighborhood and slightly south of Mt. Tabor. We're near the Seven Virtues Café, The A.N.D. Café, The Tannery, The Tabor Tavern, Portland Yoga Arts, A Fred Meyer, and a QFC. Just up the way is The Academy Theatre and all that good stuff.

The house is a wooded wonder. Our space has 4 bedrooms and 1.5 bathrooms. It's quite spacious (the room for rent is approximately 20' by 10'), with hardwood floors throughout. The kitchen has quality carpentry, marble/wood counters, updated stainless-steel appliances, and a warm red linoleum floor. The living room has a gas fireplace, a decent speaker/record player set-up, and a healthy amount of foliage. We have double pained windows that keep the heat in and the cold out. There is a 2-tiered balcony, which overlooks an unfenced yard we aptly refer to as 'the forest'. We have a couple of garden beds that are empty as of the writing of this add. As well as an untested irrigation system connected to each. Put simply: it's a nice home.

Us:

We are two men and two women in our mid twenties to early thirties. A sweet baby puppy dog who just turned one!

All of us are more than the sum of our parts, not bound by nutshells and are kings and queens of infinite space.

We are raw feelers. Deep thinkers. Wild believers. Tea drinkers. Morning contemplaters. We are quiet at night (shhh). We are vegan. We are not vegan. Each of us is an artist in our own right. We are trying to own all of ourselves even our contradictions. We read Hindu and Buddhist texts, and we watch Netflix. We practice many types of yoga, and we own a PS4. We love Leo Tolstoy, Jack Gilbert, Milan Kundera, Daniel Quinn, Aldous Huxley, and we think Star Trek Deep Space Nine is a masterpiece.

In the kingdom of homogeneity we are your monsters.

We are yogic, rock collecting, meditating, star children. . .with a dog named after a character from star trek.

If you're still reading, we're thrilled! We want you to know that this is a come as you are space, but we are looking for a functional community vibe. We don't need to share food or have dinners together. We don't care if your diet matches ours. You don't have to like the things we like. We are unconcerned about your gender. We do need you to be respectful and clean. Perhaps even exceptionally clean, as the house feels nice when it is well cared for and we feel that taking care of one's home is both rewarding and necessary.
We like to talk with each other about our thoughts and feelings. As clear, thoughtful communication is already a feat unto itself, it would be nice to live with another person who isn't hiding from the way they feel or too passive to let it be known to others.

The Nitty-Gritty:

We pay for gas, electricity, and Wi-Fi; the owner, who is attentive to our needs, covers all other utilities. This includes yard maintenance. The rent for the space is going to be $600 for an individual. Dogs are welcome. Your space is a finished room in a partially-un earthed basement. It's a recent addition with good light and hardwood floors. Two closet spaces with your own entrance. However! Your room would be adjacent to the laundry room and garage which are considered shared spaces. Bikes come through that entry way as well. The room isn't intended for the sun shy isolationist or the career musician. Sound travels too well throughout the house and we want to know ya!

Please email us about yourself. Be thorough. Indicate you read the add in its entirety.

Be well.

title: Large, Light Filled Room in Mature Household
postBody:
This is not the usual shared housing situation. If this is the right fit for you, you'll absolutely love it because. . .

• It is a very stable, harmonious household of mature singles. Most people stay a long time and leave because of life changes (marriage, buying own house, moving out of state, etc.)

• It's in a highly desirable neighborhood, literally footsteps from Whilshire Park, between Alberta Arts and Beaumont shopping/restaurant districts.

• The house is very large, and natural light streams through multiple windows in every room

• Your room measures about 14 X 15 -- much bigger than most, with ample closet space

• A clean, generous sized bathroom is located just outside your bedroom door (shared with one other person)

• Your room has phone, internet and TV cable hookups, plus the house has WIFI

• The kitchen is large, and has two refrigerators -- plenty of space for your food

• Free laundry

• Garage parking for your bike

• We recycle almost everything, think green and do our best to stay aware and be earth friendly

• We are close to two bus routes (70, 24), plus routes 75 & 17 less than ½ mile

• New Seasons Grocery, the Alberta and Beaumont shopping districts, and the Kennedy School are all within walking / biking distance.


But, lovely and inviting as it is, it's not for everyone.

Here are some details that will either be a turn off for you or make this household even more attractive!

* Current housemates are all mature (youngest 28, oldest 63), all very healthy and active.

* Seeking only one house mate (sorry, no couples or parent/child)

* Please work outside the home (not available for home office or business)

* No pets. No smoking, no drugs or excessive drinking.

* Though we each eat quite healthily, meat / fish/ chicken are cooked in the kitchen. If you find that offensive, it's not a good match.

$525 rent plus $100 utilities = $625/month

We're a lively, harmonious, progressively minded household and would enjoy hearing from you if you're interested. Please mention that you caught the part about our ages.

E-mail for more information or call 503-two 8 two-0115.

title: ***** April 1st Move In Date For SW Portland / Downtown Lair Hill Room
postBody:
Hey there! We will have a room available in our SW 2nd and Hooker St. home (the hooker house) on April 1st. Room size is 10x12 feet. We live in a really beautiful 1800's house with great views of the things.

**Side note, we are trying to get a commitment for filling the room by the end of this weekend so if you are going to shoot an email do it now :)

About us:

Raul, 23- Coolest one/best one.

Lorena, 19- Has a cat, loves the oil, goes to college and is a girl.

Ryland, 20- Probably has a huge penis.

Seth, 19- Likes to bang his girlfriend and play video games.

You- tell us about yourself! The more we know about you in your reply, the more likely we are going to respond and want to meet you! What are your interests, hobbies, goals, favorite cereal, favorite bands/musicians. Linking us to your facebook/social media site(s) also gives a better idea of who you are.

House dynamics: we all get along very well. If there is an issue we all discuss it and come to an agreement. We are 420 friendly, but if you are going to smoke make sure it's either outside-not in the common areas. It can be loud at times but we always are respectful of each others schedules.

We wouldn't consider ourselves a 'party house' (we don't want to see your drunk ass friends passed out on the couch every night) but your drunk ass friends can totally pass out on the couch infrequently. We sometimes have get togethers (we've done some house shows, general parties, art nights etc.), so we like to have a good time, just with keeping everyone elses well being in mind at the same time.

Room Specifics- rent will be $450 a month. Utilities (water, gas, electric, internet) range anywhere between $30-$60 depending on which month of the year (winter months tend to cost more). There will be a mandatory $350 deposit that is refundable when you move out.

We're looking for someone who can commit to at least 6 months.

title: One bedroom for rent in 950 sq/ft Condo
postBody:
Hello craigslisters,

I am looking for a roommate to rent the second bedroom in my two story condo starting April 1st. The condo has two bedrooms and full bath upstairs that we would share, as well as a kitchen/living room/bathroom and laundry room on the lower floor. The carpet in the photos has been replaced with hardwood. Rent is $600 a month plus utilities. Move in costs would be $1000 for deposit/last month, and a $30 credit check fee. Sorry, but no couples and no dogs, it's a small place! Cats are possible if its a good fit with my cat.

I am Luke, a guy in my early 20's (he/his or they/them pronouns), who is currently living alone with just my cat, but will be moving in to my new place around the same time as my future roommate. I am in my last year at PSU studying architecture, and I tutor CS students also at PSU for work. I tend to be fairly quiet when I am home, and am very considerate of those I am living with. However I do have friends over on occasion. I am 420 friendly, queer friendly and just generally friendly and low drama.

I am interested in a roommate who is relaxed and reliable. Preferably around my age, and employed/going to school. Basically, I don't spend all my time at home, and would like to live with someone who is likewise busy and occupied.

If you are interested, send me an email with any questions you may have and some information about yourself (This part is important, I would like to know about any hobbies/interests, job, etc.), and we can arrange to meet up and see if we are a good fit!


(P.S. If you have seen this ad before, its because I posted it, and lacked time to follow up with all the moving and such. I'm all moved in now though)

title: Room for Rent just outside Woodstock
postBody: Just moved into a 2bd, 1bth house in the middle of February.  I'm a 32 m originally from the Seattle area.  I have a very sweet and mellow collie/ blue heeler female dog who gets along with everyone. The house is located just outside the woodstock area. Just got out of a relationship, we had shared furniture, etc.. needless to say i'm kind of starting from scratch. Anyways, I work full time at a great job and make decent money. Rent is somewhat negotiable looking at around 400-500 dollars and perhaps have utilities included but again all is negotiable. The house has a big backyard and street parking. Plenty of room for storage. Also as a warning.. The house is pretty old, and the best I describe it to friends is a "frat house" not in the party atmosphere just in the old school piece of it.  Drawstring room lights, old windows, etc. I'm slowly painting walls, putting in new light fixtures... W&D next month... I'm pretty clean and pick up after myself as I go and expect the same. When i'm not working my 9-5 job I enjoy watching movies, going out to new restaurants, bars, taking my dog to the park, camping, and going to live shows. When replying back please send a picture, description of your self, facebook link, anything to help me learn who you are and if it would be a good fit. The room is available immediately. Thanks!

title: Upstairs suite available in 3bd/2ba house off Alberta!
postBody:
Hello potential roommates! We've got a large, unfurnished room opening up April 1 in a lovely 3bd/2ba duplex off NE Alberta St. It's the largest room in the house, and comes with your own bathroom! The house has a great front porch, a garden area in the back, and a covered patio area off the side. The open room is upstairs, and there is also a guest room/project room upstairs. Friendly and quiet street. Rent is $600 (or $850 for a couple) plus shared water/power/internet.

About the housemates: a mid-20s straight couple, and 1 stripey orange cat named Oliver. We both have work/school during the day, so we need someone who can respect that sleep schedule. I am a grant writer for a nonprofit and I enjoy hiking, playing piano and tending the garden. My partner is a student at PSU and a professional trumpet player. We have had great success living with housemates here and are very conscious about not being "that couple" that takes over the house. We want you to make this place your home!

What we're looking for: A fellow 20-something person or couple, responsible, and able to pay rent/bills on time. Hopefully you will have your own life and interests, but also enjoy catching up with roommates when we're home together. Willing to help keep common areas clean, ok with trumpet/piano playing during reasonable hours, and no smoking in the house. Willing to take on a bill, and looking to stay at least 6 months (lease is month to month).

If this sounds like a good place to live, please respond via email with a bit about yourself and what you're looking for in a housing situation. We are available to show the place tomorrow, Sunday 4/22 after noon, or weeknights after 6, so please include your availability and your phone number so we can schedule you in. Move-in costs will be first month's rent plus a $500 deposit.

Looking forward to hearing from you, and happy house hunting!

title: Rooms April 1st
postBody:
Hey!
Craigslist Land!

*edit*
Ok, looks like we need to clarify the age of the house.
We range from 26 to 51. Also if you set a time to come over and meet us and don't show up that says volumes about you. 1. Look at the zip code 97211, Google it, if that area is too far out or you don't like it then don't waste our time. Really, we had way to many flakes this weekend.
*edit*

Looks like it's time to find a few more roommates as we've just had two of ours hook up and they're getting a place of their own. Yep. It's dreaded "find some new roommates" time.

We have an old funky place in N.E. PDX on a decent chunk of yardage/land/dirt/grass, cats, dogs and some chickens from time to time. We have central AC (Ha! Suckers!) Laundry room, kitchen, bathroom. Living rooms, your own room, 17 large trees, 4.7 million blades of grass and a partridge in a pear tree. . . If you grow a pear tree and supply the Partridge. . ..

It saves us on trash and even cooking and cleaning up if we just all pitch in. I'll buy food for one week, we all make and grub it (and clean it all up) then the next guy or couple does the next. So yeah, you shouldn't be an uptight paranoid bean counter or leach either (you know who you are). It's our home not a motel. Do you want a home or motel? We have no maid service but I'm available for hire at $25.00 an hour so we can work something out. . .

The rent is $420 and yeah it's like that and if you're not move and down the high way, get on down the. . .. Oh. Wait. Right.
Anyway.
The rent is $420 due on the freakin 1st and if you can't cough up the cash you must communicate/talk.speak/e-mail/knock on door before the end of the next full moon or snow. Ok? There is a refundable deposit. As long as you're not a freak, turn into a vampire (well. . .) or enjoy sneaking into people's room to fart when they're not home. Basically the deposit is to cover your last month's utility bills. You know. The one your last roommates got after you were 15000 miles away, the e-mails you ignore. . ... Yeah, we know. . .

We split the utilities evenly between all residents. If you are a couple that means you pay an even split and your partner pays an even split. 1+1 does not equal 1. comprende? If you have a cat, fish, gerbil, meercat, fuzzy, snake, lizard they are off the hook on utilities.
We have a few dogs here. Dogs are always good people but people can be bad dogs. That said, we're full up on doggies here.

Speaking of such ridiculous things as being responsible and living with people. . ..
There is not a very fine line between OCD being anal and taking out the trash when it's getting full. Nope. That line is loud and smugly. Kind of smelly too. Thing is you need to be the kind of person that doesn't put food on the stove, run back to your room while your spaghetti sauce is splattering a texture all over the stove only to run back out slop your slop on a plate to run back to your room to do whatever it was that's important enough to screw over your roommates. . .. Sigh. Don't be a jerk or jerkette. We are not a residential treatment care facility

We like happy positive people because we are happy positive people that wouldn't mind making the place theirs. Well. . . As long as "yours' doesn't mean we have to clean you dishes to cook our food. Oh, yeah. We do have a few rules, like how the garbage is done. These are more like guidelines as we know what works here but we've had people that felt a great need to change the guidelines so we had to make them rules.

Otherwise the place is really nice in the summer. You can have gardens and there's lots of room we are 420 friendly but not alcohol and hard drugs especially meth will be reported to the fuzz. Contact us if you are a regular human that animals don't run away from or growl at that enjoys being around others and don't have sinister agendas.
Thanks.

title: 155 square foot bedroom in shared home $700/month
postBody:
Hello,
This a posting for a shared bedroom within a 3 bedroom, 1 bath home located in North Portland.
The location has been called "ideal" by prior tenants in regard to the following criteria:
1. Quality of landlord
2. Condition of room and cleanliness of shared living spaces
3. Proximity to mass transit and the popular North Mississippi Avenue restaurants, bars, and shopping
4. Highly popular neighborhoods of Alberta Arts District and North Williams and Overlook are in close proximity for biking, jogging, exploring the city.
5. Approximately 4 miles from the main downtown city center.

The room is 150 square feet in size with 9 foot ceilings. There are hard wood floors and plaster walls that are all in very good condition.

Other amenities and details:
1. Monthly Rent is $700 and this includes all utilities
2. The room is partially furnished with full size mattress (no frame), 40 sq. ft. area rug, armoire (no closet), desk, dresser and chair.
3. Access to Large shared restroom with clawfoot tub and shower. Storage available in restroom for personal toiletries.
4. Large shared kitchen with built in eating area.
5. Laundry available onsite in basement
6. Huge shared living room with fireplace, 2 large couches, and comfy lounge chair and TV.
7. Large outdoor deck with west facing exposure. Excellent place in the summer months.

We are: two professional and active men ages 24 and 37 and one yellow lab mix. We share house responsibilities and pay for a cleaning service on a monthly basis. We keep the house clean as we like to have friends over to enjoy the home. We eat healthy, always have coffee on hand and spend weekends getting outside for hikes, volcano climbing, ski instruction and beach trips.
I work from home but also travel extensively and regularly. My home office occupies the central "dining room" but it is visually separated from the living room.

You are: Male or female, motivated, energetic and interested in living in a positive, open-minded and energetic household. Willing to keep the shared spaces clean and clear of messes as a form shared respect. If you enjoy gardening that would be a plus... We have a large back yard that is almost ready for planting.

No pets at this point. One dog is enough and she is wonderfully well behaved.
