title: LARGE Room+Private Bathroom+Walkin Closet@Beautiful House
postBody:
Hi! I'm looking for a roommate to share my beautiful home in the Foster-Powell neighborhood. The master suite is yours, which comes complete with en-suite bathroom and large walk-in closet. The house is large (1700 sq ft), and is new (built in 2011).

The house consists of an open-plan front room/dining area/kitchen, with an additional office space and half-bathroom on the ground floor. The kitchen has a large fridge-freezer, gas stove and dishwasher, and the front room has a beautiful gas fireplace. Downstairs has beautiful hardwood floors throughout. Upstairs are 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms. There is also a washer and dryer on the upper level of the house for laundry. Outside there is a garage with storage space for your bicycle, and there is a front and back garden you are welcome to work on or just lounge about in when the weather's nice. Also located moments away from Mount Tabor park, which is great for a lovely walk or run.

The house is heated by gas, and also has central air conditioning for comfortable sleeping during the hot summer months.

About me: 44 years old man, I work full time in organic produce (meaning produce perks for you!). My weekdays are mostly taken up with the work and exercise routine, plus a little time with a few important friends. I tend to go to bed early and rise early, and I'm looking for someone with similar habits (this is not a party house). Weekends I spend with my 4-y.o. little boy, who stays over most Friday and Saturday nights.

About you: I'm looking for a positive person who is professionally employed or is a full-time student in a graduate program. You keep regular hours, and appreciate quiet at night. You like kids, and they like you. Perhaps you even have a child who comes over to stay occasionally? You are a respectful person and communicate in a clear and positive manner.

The room is $500 per month + utilities . Total move in costs are first month rent +375 security deposit . Utilities are electric, gas, water and internet. The room is unfurnished (the bed and table in the pics will be removed, unless you want to use them..)

Sorry, no pets. Sorry, no smokers.

If you're interested, drop me an email with some information about yourself. Include a phone number. If it sounds like we'd be a good fit, we can take it from there. Thanks!

title: Share beautiful 3 bdrm house w/ huge yard in Woodstock
postBody:
I need a roommate to share a beautiful spacious 3 bedroom mid-century ranch style house in Woodstock. We've got 3 bedrooms, a large front room, dining room, a really nice bright kitchen with lots of space and a cute breakfast nook and laundry facilities. All of the rooms have large windows so the house is nice and bright even on those cloudy days. There is one and a half baths. The main bathroom is set up for two people.

There is a very large yard (double lot) so a love of gardening would be a plus. We do have to care for the yard. I have a yard person to mow. Someone who will stick around and garden with me every now and again would be great. I will need help with the yard even if you don't garden, there are leaves to rake and a general sense of care is important.

There is central air and heat along with a wood fireplace. The house is also on a major bus route and very close to Woodstock shops and the New Seasons that is going in.

I am looking for a quiet and kind roommate. I am laid back and clean, but I'm not obsessive. We can have a party or two and the yard is really set up for some great summer parties, but all in all I work hard and need my sleep, so quiet after bedtime on the weekdays is needed.

I have a dog and a cat. Someone who understands and loves animals is important.

Someone who is responsible pays their rent on time is a must. Friendly is good! Someone who works hard or studies hard will fit in just right.

There is flexibility on how much you want to share the house. The front room is open for furniture and complete share. The dining room is free for furniture and share as well. There are two free rooms and I can take one or not. So your rent depends on how much space you want to take. It will be between $800 and $1000 plus some utilities (depending on how much space you take). For move in you need first and last months rent plus an $800 deposit. Move by April. You will need to be approved by the owner who will require an application and a credit check.

title: Room available! Small urban farm setting
postBody:
THE HOUSE:
A 3 bedroom 2 bath ranch style home with hardwood floors. It's just a block or two away from the Springwater Corridor Trail. Quiet street. Also easy access to I205. Front and back yards are fenced and filled with gardens, fruit trees (some still quite small), and a fenced area belonging to our 2 pygmy goat friends and 5 chickens. They are very amusing to hang around with. Washer and dryer in the laundry room. Wood stove in the living room. My partner and I have a bathroom in our room so you would mostly have the main bathroom to yourself (except for the occasional guest or one of us using it from time to time.) We simply ask that you keep it clean. There's a lot of cupboard and shelf space in the bathroom.

We reuse, recycle, compost and use natural cleaning products. No drinking/no smoking house.

CURRENT HOUSE INHABITANTS:
I'm 36 yrs old, trans male qpoc, i love plants, cooking, gardening, hiking with the goats, being amused by the furry and feathered friends here, being creative, working with herbs, and am building a small herbal tea/educational business. I do some work from home and also work full time outside of the house. I enjoy doing projects in the yard and house and like spending time outside of the city. I like to keep shared space clean, can be social and also enjoy time to myself. I go in and out of regular meditation practice.

My partner is 34 yrs old, also enjoys gardening and creating fun, pleasant, usable space. This ranges from house and yard projects to quiet time with an art project. She enjoys dance and movement in many forms. She loves being outside in beautiful places and enjoys trips out of the city. She's sometimes social and sometimes taking time to herself. She occasionally gets into pie baking mode and that's always delicious. She works full time out of the house. Generally Sun-Thurs.

Oscar the cat does a lot of sleeping and purring in various desirable locations around the house and yard. We've been best buds for about 17 years now. Oscar's very sweet and tends to be nervous around other animals who pay too much attention to him.

YOU:
You are thoughtful of shared space, happy to wash your dishes, and chip in with sweeping and such. You have a reliable income and pay your rent/bills on time. You are queer and trans friendly and generally open minded. You are pretty quiet after 10pm and before 8am. You are happy to live in a house with no alcohol/drugs whether or not you partake elsewhere. Ideally it would be nice if you enjoy the plants and animals that live here as well. Lets see.. why don't you tell us more..

THE ROOM FOR RENT:
Around 140 square feet, has a ceiling fan, closet with some built in shelves and a window that faces west and the backyard - Rent is $425. Utilities (electric, water/sewer, trash, wifi, wood) is $125. SO, Rent + Utils = $550/ month. Available March 17th. Lease is month-to-month but we are hoping to find someone for a long term situation.

Email me with questions and let me know a little about yourself and what you're looking for in a living situation. When are you looking to move in somewhere? For how long?

$550 Rent/util + $550 security dep. to move in. We could work out a way to split up the security deposit if needed.

I listed the cross streets below - the house itself is on Clatsop St where there is no traffic and it feels very private.

Thanks!
Daniel

title: One roommate wanted for our awesome house near Mississippi!
postBody:
We're a group of four looking for a fifth housemate to fill an upstairs room in our adorable house beginning April 1. We live right next to all the shops and restaurants on N. Williams and a short walk to N. Mississippi. Five minutes to downtown by car, and we're on the Vancouver/Williams bikeway, and there's public transit galore in our 'hood.

Our house has an amazing porch, an awesome back deck and a dreamy garden/yard full of flowers and plants. Yard is fully fenced.

We are all in our mid-20s: 3 gals, 1 guy and 2 sweet, fantastic pooches. We are all friendly, relaxed folks with jobs. Emily works at Powell's and likes riding her horse and snuggling with Tina, her sweet chunky-monkey dog. Anya works at Papa Haydn's and spoils us with sweet treats. Alex works for Portland Running Company and is building a tiny house. Lindsey is a bartender and also has a sweet pup.

We all get along so well that there could be a sitcom about us if only we weren't so boringly pleasant to each other. We sometimes hang out for drinks or crappy TV marathons, and we're friends, but we won't bug you if you'd rather not see our faces that much. We are not the passive-aggressive note-leaving, house meeting type of deal -- we trust that we can coexist comfortably and happily without micromanagement, and we're looking for a roommate who digs that. The closest you'll come to house "management" is a note on the chalkboard that says, "I cleaned the kitchen! Let's keep it nice." We are aggressively unconcerned with your sexual preferences, food choices, recreational activities and political leanings (as long as you're not the worst. Homophobes/animal kickers/racists/bullies need not apply). We keep the kitchen pretty clean, but we don't look like a model home. We're all willing to help out with the cleaning, but our natural state isn't immaculate. You shouldn't eat off the floor, but you don't do that anyway, right?

The space ($590 for your room):
*Upstairs, shares a bathroom with Emily and Alex. The other two rooms use different bathrooms and are on different floors.
*Carpeted
*Normal-sized -- can fit a full bed, desk, dresser, shelves, etc.
*Windows that give awesome light all day.
*W/D in the basement
*Street parking and enclosed driveway that we don't use but you can if you want.
*We're fully furnished (the room is NOT), but you're welcome to bring whatever you want and we can make room.

We're looking for someone who:
*is just one person. Sorry, but our lease only allows a total of five people.
*plays well with others and is sane
*is employed or in school or can otherwise pay your bills on time every time (seriously, be able to pay your bills)
*likes dogs. Our pups are part of the family, and you should expect to be cuddled if you're in the common areas. They're well-behaved and total darlings. No more pets, sorry!
*doesn't run a tarantula-breeding business or similar

Serious Business:
*Our lease requires an $1120 deposit per housemate. We know, we know, it's a big deposit. Our landlord did it that way instead of asking a deposit+last month's rent. The house and neighborhood are worth it! And you'll get it back when you move out! Think of it as a savings account? The roommates who have switched out in the past have all gotten their full deposits back. Our landlord is awesome and fair, and unless you ditch us without notice, don't pay your rent or take a sledge hammer to the walls, you are going to get the deposit back. IF everything else seems perfect but you can't swing the whole deposit, let us know and we can work something out where one of us puts in and extra half (and gets that amount back).
*We split utilities and internet evenly. Averaging about $70 total per person for the summer, and a little higher once heat goes on. Water is quarterly. To be safe you should budget $100ish for bills each month.
*Our lease runs until January 2016, and if we're all still happy we can re-sign.

Let us know if you want to check the place out or talk with us!

title: guy and dog need guy housemate
postBody:
I find that I have better luck with guys so I would prefer a guy. I'm willing to entertain the possibility of another dog, with plenty of provisions. Any other kind of animal is going to be seen as food by the existing dog.

The house is located a short walk to Mississippi Ave and a shorter walk to the Williams shopping district. New Seasons is just down the street.

We're on a major bus line and bike lane and we're 5 minutes from downtown by car, if anyone wants to attempt that.

Utilities and fast internet included, $550. First and last required. Available 1 April.

14 1/2' X 12' upstairs room with additional 3' x 8' closet.

Easy going, drama free, relatively quiet except when I'm making noise. Noise is typically music making.

Features include: washer/dryer, dishwasher, cable internet, reverse osmosis water, plenty of cooking paraphernalia, espresso machine, kitchen gadgets, tech based alarm system, canine based alarm system, charming dog (more about this later), commuter bike parking on the front porch, limited storage in the basement, natural wood floors throughout, a bathroom with a kickass shower, another bathroom with an excellent tub.

The house is a 3 bedroom Victorian that has mostly been restored and is always improving. There is a living room, dinning room, library, antechamber to the library, breakfast room , front porch, small courtyard in back with a bench, two bathrooms etc. We recycle everything possible, keep the temperature at a balmy 60 during the day and 62 in the evening, flush only when necessary and generally try to be as green as possible.

I'm looking for someone who will want to make this home and stay for a long time. It sucks to have people moving in and out. I've had many housemates who have stayed between 1 and 3 years and that's ideal. I realize things change, but be honest with intent, please.

READ THIS CAREFULLY ! Certain things in artificial fragrance give me respiratory problems so NO perfume, smelly soap or shampoo, body spray, scented candles, hair product, laundry soap, those horrible things people put in the dryers, scented toilet paper, whatever else may have chemical scents. Natural scent is ok, but seriously, almost everything has "fragrance" in the fine print ,which means chemical, so none of it please. Seriously: IT MAKES ME ILL. And if you have friends who bathe in perfume and visit you often, you will have to do something to try and keep the perfume out.

I'm a classical musician and woodworker. http://www.minnerlyfurniture.com So there is music playing and practicing at times. I have no problem with musicians as long as it's not loud electric. The room is well situated to not bother neighbors by practicing. I have my woodworking shop in the basement, so I make noise down there sometimes but I try to do it when people are away or, at least, when no one is sleeping. I sometimes have people over to play music.

The house is filled with antiques, some of which have been in my family for 200 years, so you need to be able to live around antiques. The furniture can be used but not abused. THIS IS IMPORTANT. If you have only lived with particle board and plastic furniture and don't know how to behave around nice furniture then you can stop reading here.

YOU MUST LIKE DOGS. Seriously, I don't mean tolerate, I mean like. If you are willing to make the effort to be friends and relate to her, all will be good, if not there will be annoying barking which will not be blamed on her. It's pretty simple; if you like her she's awesome. She's a really smart sheltie.

Unfortunately, the servants, scullery maids, and housekeepers have been let go, so we all have to pitch in to keep things clean. It's one of those annoying austerity measures that we have to live with. I take responsibility for most of the vacuuming and dusting, but if people use the kitchen and bathrooms then I expect that people will help keep them clean. Cleaning up after yourself is a start, but that is only some of what it takes to keep things clean.

I don't eat mammals, although I do eat birds and fishes. If you're a militant non meat eater, be warned that Argos, the dog, does eat meat; raw crunchy bones with meat. I don't mind meat eating as long as it's a minimum and doesn't involve lots of frying. Frying and sauteing are antiquated ways of cooking according to my French cookbook. I don't fry things and prefer that it be kept to a minimum; it gets grease all over the house, makes the house smell like a fast food joint and is bad for your health. If you equate cooking with frying, then this isn't for you. I prefer someone with some awareness of clean natural eating. Sharing meals is nice but almost never works out with peoples schedules, so whatever.

title: Room for rent in nice SE woodstock home
postBody:
Hi potential roommates,

I have a small room for rent in my Woodstock home.

About the room/ house
The room is about 10x10. Lots of windows with built in wooden blinds. Nice Hardwood floors, and a ceiling fan and light. Also, there are a lot of power outlets in the room. This room would be best for someone that does not have a lot of furniture, although there is plenty of storage in the garage and basement. The house is pretty small, but very functional. There is a dishwasher that works great, as well as washer and dryer in the basement- both in great working order as well. The entire house has nice hardwood floors. And lots of storage space in the detached garage, as well as the basement. Which you would be welcome to use for storage. There is only one bathroom in the house, so you would have to be ok with sharing a bathroom. The shower is amazing and has two shower heads. The house has central heating and stays warm and cozy in the winter months. There are lots of big shady trees on the property, so I imagine the summers I'll stay fairly cool in the house. There is a good sized front porch, where my dog spends most of his time. The lot itself is hug, there is a big front yard and a large back yard as well. The entire property is fenced in, and there is plenty of room in the yard for gardening, raised beds etc. the neighborhood is great and very safe, nearby an elementary school. So, it's a family neighborhood.

About me

I am in my mid 20's working in the restaurant world, and going to school. I am not a party person, but I do enjoy a glass or wine, or two from time to time. My friend lives in the granny unit that is attached to the garage. She is also in her mid 20's working a very full time job. Due to her job, she is not home for 3 full days and nights each week. We are two very easy going, social girls that are ideally looking for someone similar to ourselves. However, that does not mean we are only open to other female roommates. If you are a clean, tidy male we would love to meet you as well. I have a siberian husky that is 2 and very friendly, he loves other dogs and people. I also have a cat, that spends most of his time hiding in my room or outside in the yard. Because I have two animals, I would not like anymore animals living on the property. I am kind of a clean freak, not OCD but I generally keep my house and main living areas cleaner than the average person. Let me know if this sounds like something you might be interested in and I would be happy to send you pictures and more info.

The room is $500 plus utilities. The house is small, so utilities don't tend to be very high. But just like everywhere in Portland, water is probably the highest bill- compared to the other utilities. Looking to rent by April 20th

title: 1-BR available in 2-BR house, Buckman area

title: Room/Floor in Charming Close-in House
postBody:

The bedroom that comes with the rental is in a nicely finished daylight basement space that has high ceilings (8'). Please see photos. It is a spacious room and includes a nearly exclusive use "ante-room." This house share includes use of the other rooms in the house and a sharing of two full bathrooms -- one on the first floor, the other on the second floor.

The household environment is laid-back but respectful - enviro-friendly with an emphasis on eating healthy, recycling, no or very little tv, visiting with friends, relaxing, etc. In general, warm and friendly, yet independent. I'm 50, male, and rather involved with my work and outside work activities, so I'm not home that much. House comes with a veggie garden, yard, and some native plantings, etc. Chickens may arrive this spring.

I tend to cook once or twice a week or so and am open to an occasional food or meal share.

Neighborhood is close-in and "neighborly." All the households on the street have dinner together one night a month. It is a soup night that moves to a different neighbor's house each month. Quiet at night. Near Whole Foods (at Fremont & NE 15th), Irving Park, Broadway stores, etc. Close to bus lines, bike lanes, and Max (6 or 7 blocks).

W/D on site. Wireless included. Renter to pay a $120/mo utility charge (which covers ALL utilities -- gas, elec., water, sewer, wifi, trash, recycling).

Photos are of room, ante-room, dining room, kitchen and living room.

Thanks for your interest. Please let me know if you have any questions. In a reply to this post, please say a little about yourself and what you are looking for in housing. Note that I'm looking for a single (ie, an individual, not a couple). Having boy/girl-friends over is of course ok, just not looking for a couple right off the bat. Pets are on a case-by-case basis.

Cheers, Steve

title: Male Christian Friendly, Drug/Alcohol Free House - May 1st
postBody:
Got the notice from one of my housemates he's moving out end of april, getting married, so we need some new blood... Our place is obviously only for a select few given the house rules and such, but maybe that's you... we're seriously a calm mellow bunch and easy to get along with and friendly... but not overly friendly needing to be in your face all the time hanging out...

The house is a Drug and Alcohol free house (this includes your room and the house property)... if you drink, just respect the house rules and don't do it here (and for sure not interested in heavy drinkers at all - or drug users of any kind - including pot)... It's also a NO Cohabitation house, so no girlfriends sleeping over, etc. We're looking for a good decent drama free guy, of course another Christian believer in the house would be great (all 3 of us are), but its not a must.... also you MUST be working or in school with financial aid (no one can live here if theres not a set in stone method for paying rent... if these house rules are livable for you, you will get along great here...

1 Room on main floor... its about 11 x 12 or so and has 2 windows... bathroom a few feet away...

The rent for this room is a flat $400 INCLUDING normal utilities (and wireless internet - normal bandwidth useage)... this does not include the use of an AC unit, that would be about $25 more a month for normal, not 24/7 use (this rate could change if our bill jumps a lot more than normal)... but a fan use is no charge (with the two windows, a fan can usually do the total trick on even the hottest days.... NO mini fridges or that kind of things in the room.... The house has a washer and dryer that you may use for free, but they are not part of rent, just a courtesy, so don't abuse their use (5 or less loads a month).

No pets, minus say a bird or something like that, we do have two old dachshunds... they are generally decent dogs and I'm careful about excessive barking, but it is not prestine, so if you can't handle some barking, or dislike dogs, then this place isn't for you... Also we have a few chickens...

Oh yeah, from time to time we have or will have band practice in the basement (arranged at the least obtrusive time for all).... but thats not happened in quite a while, but it might... also we have the occasional house show/ concert in the main floor living/dining room areas... there will be plenty of notice of this and at most it happens a few times a year and lasts for like 4-5 hours or so start to finish.... last year it happened twice and the housemates all hung out and enjoyed it... like the house those events are drug/alcohol free as well...

6 month min, 1 year preferred commitment... $100 ($50 refundable) deposit required.

let me know if you're interested....

*Please respond to this add by leaving your "PHONE NUMBER" along with what you do for work, what your current living situation is and why you are moving. And, please also include a couple of previous roommate references. *If you do not include these, you will NOT be considered.

NO PETS!!

Thank you

title: Beautiful Couple and Dog Friendly Room, Utilities included
postBody:
We have one bedroom available in our beautiful turn of the century home. The bedroom is couple friendly with a huge closet, and we are allowed one dog in the unit, at the discretion of our landlord. All of us love dogs, but none of us own one.

About the house:

The home was built in 1910, and has hard wood throughout, as well was two large bathrooms. It is full of character, and we absolutely love it. The living room has a unique wood stove that is in working order, a spacious dining area with a window nook perfect for reading, a well-equipped kitchen with two ovens and a dishwasher, as well as a small island for all of your baking needs. The available bedroom is located on the second floor and is only steps away from the upstairs patio, which currently contains a table and chairs, as well as risen garden beds. The house has an unfinished basement with a washer and dryer, and ample storage space. There is a side patio and a fenced in back yard with fruit trees and a barbecue. There is minimal yard work. The landlord has hired a company to do most of the work, and the house comes with a push mower for tenants' use, for the small amount of bare grass. Eco-friendly and efficient! The house as a whole is surrounded by flowering trees and plants, and come spring, it will be amazing. Finally, we are 1.5 blocks from a trader Joe's, biking distance to Powell and Reed College, and right off of Cesar Chavez. The location is amazing.

About you:

We hope you are a couple or single employed young professional, or maybe even a student, that enjoys wine, dinner parties, grilling, and wants a place to live that truly feels like home. We value direct communication, and hope that you do too. We also hope that you are willing to help keep the house clean so that the beautiful preservation done by out landlord can shine through. If you want a place where you can feel proud to live, this home is for you.

About us:

We are three young professionals living in Portland. Out names are Alice, Joey and Taylor. We all love the outdoors, and are very active people. Between the three of us, we like to trail run, climb, kayak, raft, snowboard, ski, camp, canoe, backpack and mountain bike. We also like to cook, and of course the occasional Netflix marathon is welcomed. If you like to do any of these things, you'll fit right in! If not, that's ok too. To each their own! We legitimately want to be friends with our roommate, but ultimately we are respectful and just want a harmonious home.

Pricing:

The room its self is $875 for a couple or $825 for a single person. The landlord adds an additional $50 per person each month because the utilities are entirely included, hence the price difference depending on your situation. To move in, you will need to pay: 1st month's rent, last month's rent, and your equal share of the deposit, which is $1000. So, if you're a couple, you will pay $2,150. If you are one person, you will pay $1900.

Please contact Alice for a showing, we would be happy to meet with you show you the house!
